metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5163 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
If a malicious attacker has used another vulnerability to gain full control over a content process, they may be able to replace the alternate data resources stored in the JavaScript Start-up Bytecode Cache (JSBC) for other JavaScript code. If the parent process then runs this replaced code, the executed script would be run with the parent process' privileges, escaping the sandbox on content processes. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 60.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5163` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 60.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 60.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 60.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 60.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '60.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
